p: As already mentioned, the syncytium mechanism is responsible for an impairment of the immune system alike. The syncytia induced by the measles virus expressing the viral glycoproteins HA and F on their surfaces are able to suppress allogeneic mixed lymphocyte reaction between dendritic cells and T cells. In fact, cell contacts between MV-infected dendritic cells and T cells and/or uninfected dendritic cells are necessary to block allogeneic T-cell proliferation [ 67]. The elimination of these viral surface glycoproteins on dendritic cells has been shown to enable their reactivation with a recovery of the physiological immune role.
